metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9792 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: The IonMonkey just-in-time (JIT) compiler can leak an internal JS_OPTIMIZED_OUT magic value to the running script during a bailout. This magic value can then be used by JavaScript to achieve memory corruption, which results in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.6, Firefox ESR < 60.6, and Firefox < 66.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
